newsitem.title: MEXICO: Work starts on $1.465 bln water projects in Mexico.
newsitem.headline: Work starts on $1.465 bln water projects in Mexico.

text.p: Mexico has begun work on water treatment projects for which it had obtained international credits totalling $1.465 billion, a government official said on Tuesday.

"The projects will be financed by credits for $365 million and $400 million, from the Inter-American Development Bank and the Japan Overseas Economic Cooperation Fund," said Guillermo Guerrero, director of the National Water Commission.
The credits would be used to finance waste-water treatment plants in the states of Hidalgo and Mexico, and a system to drain excess rain water from Mexico City, Guerrero said.

Work had also begun on a $700 million network to supply water to inhabitants in the south and east of Mexico City and in the adjacent state of Mexico, Guerrero added, saying the project was mostly financed by the Inter-American Development Bank.
